channel.title: The Rolistes Podcast
channel.description:
Welcome among The Rolistes…
We are the proudly London-based producers of Tabletop RPG podcasts showcasing fans across the Channel, the Pond and beyond.
We cross borders, languages, fandoms, game systems and settings with unique discoveries in each episode.
Join us for a mix of discussions, RPG actual plays, travel-diaries, vox-populi, movie reviews, and even music by amazing Creative Commons artists.
Meet independent game designers, popular British publishers, immigrants, travellers visiting London or other random encounters made during our travels.
Our content is for YOU, no matter if you are a seasoned grognard or wannabe players who are about to take their first steps in The Hobby.
We are for those curious about what and how tabletop roleplaying games are played across the World, how players can have wildly different walks of life and interests can be.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Your London-based tabletop RPG shows!
channel.itunes:summary:

We are the proudly London-based producers of Tabletop RPG podcasts showcasing fans across the Channel, the Pond and beyond.

item.title: Special James Bond
item.category: Guilde des Rolistes Francophones de Londres
item.description:
For the release of S.P.E.C.T.R.E., we seize the opportunity with episode 5 to celebrate the most famous of all Britons: James Bond.

We head with the team, Haqadosh, Xany, Toto Chan and Persephelia to the Marble Odeon to find out how Bond's lastest aventure fares.

Also, Garry and James from Role Play Haven are back to discuss the special agent's place in the UK and roleplaying games.

As mentioned again in my after credit message, as part of a potential crossover with a French podcast, I would be very keen to receive questions you would have about roleplayers across the Channel. Do you want to find out what they play? Where they play? Do you have any idea for obscure questions to investigate?

If so, or if you have any comment about the podcast, please contact me through one of the following:

Email: Rolistespod@gmail.com
Twitter: @rolistespod
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Rolistespod
Google+: https://plus.google.com/communities/115198268361411183808
Wordpress: https://rolistespod.wordpress.com/

...and don't forget to...

 Subscribe in a reader

 Support The Rolistes Podcast

Listen, rate or review on ITunes or Stitcher. You can also download the episode.

The Rolistes Podcast by Kalum is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

Music
Theme song: "Solta o Franco" by Bonde Do Role

Additional songs:
"Her Majesty" by Garmisch
"Banging On My Door" by Waylon Thornton

All songs available for free download at http://freemusicarchive.org/

Gaming systems
"James Bond 007 Role-playing Game" by Gerard Christopher Klug
"Cold City" by Malcolm Craig
"Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game - Second Edition" by Bill Smith

Spy experiences in London
Bond In Motion - Covent Garden London Film Museum
Secret War - Imperial War Museum
Aqua Shard - The Shard, 32 London Bridge St, London SE1 9SG
Secret hidden bars in London - You'll have to find those yourself

What are we spying? What are we gonna spy?
"The Blacklist" NBC
"The James Bonding Podcast" by Matt Mira & Matt Gourley

Timesplit:
00:00:16 At the Odeon for Spectre
00:03:35 With James & Garry to discuss James Bond
00:04:35 Our first Bond movie
00:07:35 Our favourite Bond incarnation
00:11:07 Our favourite Bond movie
00:17:36 "Her Majesty" by Garmisch
00:19:52 James Bond 007 Role-playing Game
00:27:01 Other spy oriented gaming systems

00:37:48 Bond as a British icon

00:55:07 Spy experiences in London

item.title: Meet the Role Play Haven, Loncon & Dragonmeet
item.category: Guilde des Rolistes Francophones de Londres
item.description:
With episode 4, it is my great pleasure to introduce the listeners of The Rolistes Podcast to London's largest, and extremely friendly, gaming role playing club: Role Play Haven.

Garry and James are my guests for the first time,  and problably not the last, to introduce us to the story, achievements and ongoing activities of, Role Play Haven, which is a not only a club but also a Community Interest Company (non-profit organization).

We seize the opportunity to discuss also their own first steps in the world tabletop RPG, British gaming habits, the Loncon (72nd World Science Fiction Convention) and Dragonmeet.

See below for the details about Dragonmeet and other activities held at Role Play Haven.

As mentioned in my after credit message, as part of a potential crossover with an established French RPG podcast, I would be very keen to receive, from you all, questions you would have about roleplayers across the Channel. Do you want to find out what they play? Where they play? Do you any idea for obscure questions to investigate?

If so, or if you have any comment about the podcast, please contact me through one of the following:

Email: Rolistespod@gmail.com
Twitter: @rolistespod
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Rolistespod
Wordpress: https://rolistespod.wordpress.com/

 Subscribe in a reader

 Support The Rolistes Podcast

Listen, rate or review on ITunes or Stitcher. You can also download the episode.

The Rolistes Podcast by Kalum is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

Music
Theme song: "Solta o Franco" by Bonde Do Role

Additional songs:
"London Town" by The Shrubs
"Home" by Ramsden
"Sit In One Place" by The Carny
"Masters of Science Fiction" by The Carny

All songs available for free download at http://freemusicarchive.org/

Upcoming events
Role Play Haven Stratford Branch Weekly Games - Every Tuesday from 7pm to 10.45pm
Role Play Haven Lewisham Branch Weekly Games - Every Wednesday from 7pm to 10.45pm
Dragonmeet - Saturday 5th December 2015 from 10am to Midnight
Role Play Haven Christmas Quizz - Wednesday 16th December
Role Play Haven Game Master Workshop - Monday 25th January

Also join The Rolistes Podcast and the Guilde des Rolistes Francophone de Londres at one of our monthly drinks (next one Tuesday 24th November and Tuesday 27th January).

What are we reading? What are we gonna read?
“Star Wars: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook ” Fantasy Flight Games
“Robert E. Howard’s Conan Adventures In An Age Undreamed Of.” Modiphius
“The Walking Dead” AMC
“The Complete Chronicles of Conan” Robert E. Howard
“La Lune et Douze Lotus” John Grümph
“Saga” by Brian K Vaughan & Fiona Staples

Timesplit:
00:00:00 Meet Garry and James

item.title: Triangulo Friki, Utah Encounter & More
item.category: Guilde des Rolistes Francophones de Londres
item.description:
As we say in French, "Jamais deux sans trois". Here is Episode 3.

We take an unexpected flight to Barcelona and meet there Kanard, yet another member of the Guilde des Rolistes Francophones de Londres.

We discussed what brought him to London then Barcelona before moving onto the subject of his modest knowlegde of local geek culture such as the "Triangulo Friki".

He shares his passion for two games: Multisim's "Guildes : El Dorado" and "Aquelarre" from Ricard Ibanez.

As an interlude, I also take you to the Mercat de la Boqueria from a slice of ham and to discuss briefly the subject of tabletop roleplaying games with a friendly couple from Utah.

Thanks for listening and please, please leave me comments through one of the following.

Contact: Rolistespod@gmail.com
Twitter: @rolistespod
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Rolistespod
Wordpress: https://rolistespod.wordpress.com/

 Subscribe in a reader

 Support The Rolistes Podcast

Listen, rate or review on ITunes or Stitcher. You can also download the episode.

:)

The Rolistes Podcast by Kalum is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

Additional songs:
"Cubata de Fairy" by Las Ruinas

All songs available for free download at http://freemusicarchive.org/

item.title: Mess' Up, Arrow, Luchadores & Asian Restaurants
item.description:
With episode 2, The Rolistes Podcast is messier than ever and heavy on the French accent. Apologies,we are still getting our act sorted.

Together with Xany and Haqadosch we find out that recording a podcast while attempting to play board games is a bad idea.

In addition to the next segment of our interview with Kundin, we did manage however to discuss wrestling, covering the Arrow vs Stardust feud as well as the tabletop RPG Luchadores, before moving onto the subject of Japanese, Korean and Chinese restaurants in London.

This episode is much longer than what I aim for.

I will try to be more disciplined next time.

Thanks for listening and please, please leave me comments through one of the following.

Contact: Rolistespod@gmail.com
Twitter: @rolistespod
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Rolistespod
Wordpress: https://rolistespod.wordpress.com/

...and don't forget to suscribe to our feed.

:)

 Subscribe in a reader

 Support The Rolistes Podcast

Listen, rate or review on ITunes or Stitcher. You can also download the episode.

The Rolistes Podcast by Kalum is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

item.title: Pimm's Particles & Guilde des Rolistes Francophones de Londres
item.category: Guilde des Rolistes Francophones de Londres
item.description:
*Now in an improved "remixed" version - July 2018*

Here it is.

Messy, not prefect but aiming in the direction I want to head to.

Please be kind and, most of all, give it a shot for a couple episodes before settling your opinion.

In the meantime, I would be very thankful to receive your comments regarding the state of things, what you like and want more of, what you don't like and would like to see "corrected".

Episode summary

For our first episode, we go to Westfield Stratford to see Ant-Man and to Devon to interview Kundin, founder of the Guilde des Rolistes Francophones de Londres.

Contact: Rolistespod@gmail.com
Twitter: @rolistespod
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Rolistespod
Wordpress: https://rolistespod.wordpress.com/

...and don't forget to suscribe to our feed.

:)

 Subscribe in a reader

 Support The Rolistes Podcast

Listen, rate or review on ITunes or Stitcher. You can also download the episode.

The Rolistes Podcast by Kalum is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.
